item.title: Aspnet website in docker in windows, IIS and self-signed certificate
item.description: The application is hosted in a docker container. The actual folder with the app publish, is mapped into the container, so when the code changes it’s inmediatly reflected in the running container. Dockerfile FROMmcr.microsoft.com/dotnet/framework/aspnet:4.8SHELL [ "powershell" ]COPY src/Bustroker.LocalEnv.WebUI/bin/app.publish c:/webappADD configureIIS.ps1 /windows/temp/configureIIS.ps1RUN powershell.exe -executionpolicy bypass c:\windows\temp\configureIIS.ps1Configure IIS script configureIIS.ps1 script, copied into the image on build. # Configure SSL certificate for default website Import-Module WebAdministration Set-Location IIS:\SslBindings New-WebBinding -Name "Default Web Site" -IP "*" -Port 443 -Protocol https $c = New-SelfSignedCertificate -DnsName "localhost" -CertStoreLocation cert:\LocalMachine\My $c | New-Item 0.
